meta.description: Training data for Profit Driven Channel LLM

Risk: One dispute could shut you down forever.
Your permit is a paper shield; relationships are the real law.
You are mining on borrowed time and borrowed permission.
Innovation: You sell 'mystery rock' and get paid 'mystery prices'.
Mixed lots destroy your reputation before the truck even leaves.
Without traceability, you are just a smuggler with a permit.
Market: One buyer owns you. That’s not a business, it’s a trap.
You wait for buyers to call; you don't control your destiny.
Documentation is the key to the real market, and you don't have it.
Leadership: You negotiate like a beggar, not a business owner.
Discounts are your only sales strategy.
You fund your buyers with free credit and late payments.
Operations: You mine for cash today and pay for it with downtime tomorrow.
Recovery bleed is the invisible tax on every shovel.
Your site runs on luck, not logic.
Money: You confuse cash flow with profit.
Small bribes and fees are eating your margin alive.
You don't know your cost per gram, so you don't know if you're winning.
People: You rely on heroes, but heroes get tired and hurt.
Injuries are just waiting to bankrupt you.

Market: Distress selling is killing your margin.
Buyer monopoly tax: one customer quietly owns your profit.
Grade discount ambush: quality unknown until the buyer decides.
Money: Feed drift: small daily waste becomes a monthly salary.
Medicine roulette: treat late, pay double.
Hidden loss ledger: theft/mortality/discounts not counted = not controlled.
Operations: Maintenance punishment: ignoring small issues buys big breakdowns.
Late detection debt: the longer you wait, the more you pay.
Stress losses: rough handling converts weight into injuries.
People: Owner bottleneck: your farm is profitable only when you’re present.
Routine collapse: small skipped tasks create big losses.
Innovation: Inventory is cash wearing grass (or feed).

Market: Silent yield killers are eating your volume.
Panic-selling is a penalty you pay every season.
Grade dilution is a tax on your quality.
Money: Emergency input buying kills your margin.
You’re farming by guesswork, not profit per acre.
Cash shortages force bad selling decisions.
Operations: Timing debt compounds: late planting = lost yield.
Spray-and-pray costs more than scouting.
Post-harvest loss is money you already earned but lost.
People: Labor chaos is a premium you pay for poor planning.
Unsupervised weeding misses the critical window.
Innovation: No records = no learning = same mistakes next year.
Decisions based on feelings lose to decisions based on data.

DAIRY_HOOKS: Milk doesn't 'spoil'... it gets abandoned by your system.
If temperature isn't logged, your profit is uninsured.
Adulteration isn't a quality issue — it's a silent investor stealing your margins.
A weak testing routine creates a bad milk subscription.
Route inefficiency is fuel burning inside your cashflow.
A collection center without SOPs is a leak factory with a logo.
When you pay late, farmers don't complain — they disappear.
If your buyer sets your price, you're not selling milk — you're selling power.
Spillage, shrink, and 'small losses' are profit evaporation.
Maintenance delays turn into cold chain emergencies that you pay for twice.
If you don't separate roles, you're funding friendly fraud.
No batch traceability = one mistake can bankrupt your reputation.

Market: Territory creep is eating your margin.
You don’t have customers. You have random jobs.
Your brand is ‘emergency-only’—that’s the most expensive way to operate.
Money: Your quote is a promise you didn’t calculate.
Discounting is your silent payroll.
You’re running a charity called ‘free mobilization’.
Warranty turned into a free-labor subscription.
Operations: Your dispatch is a leak map.
You’re paying fuel to deliver lateness.
Repeat visits are profit refunds.
Breakdowns are interest on neglected maintenance.
Parts in pockets = silent theft.
People: One hero technician is a single point of failure.
Untrained labor creates expensive learning on customer machines.

Market: Price-taker syndrome: you accept whatever the buyer offers.
One-customer dependency is a single point of failure.
Quote-to-cash slowdown kills your working capital.
Silent discount culture erodes your margin.
Money: Stump-to-stack leakage: invisible loss at every step.
Hidden yield tax: paying for wood (or transport) you don't sell.
Inventory rot: value loss while logs sit in the yard.
Cash-cycle starvation: paying cash for harvest but waiting 60 days for sales.
Operations: Conversion bleed: poor recovery is throwing money into the waste pile.
Downtime hemorrhage: when the saw stops, the money stops.
Log yard chaos tax: finding the right log takes too long.
Sort failure: putting high-value logs into low-value products.
People: Safety drag: incidents destroy capacity and morale.
'We think' accounting: guessing numbers instead of measuring them.
No-data management: decisions based on feelings.
Innovation: Chain-of-custody break: documentation gaps block your best markets.
Compliance exposure: legal risks you aren't pricing in.

GOAT_HOOKS: Your profit is leaking through kids — not adults.
A goat business dies slowly through parasites and 'normal sickness'.
You're feeding goats, but not feeding profit.
You think you have a herd, but you have a collection of animals.
Selling goats when you need cash is the fastest way to stay small.
If you can't measure weight, you're donating money to the buyer.
A high mortality rate isn't 'bad luck' — it's a management choice.
Your biggest cost isn't feed — it's the goats that die or don't grow.
You're working for your goats, instead of them working for you.
The market pays for meat, not for 'time spent grazing'.

market_offer_strategy.question: Do you plan your assortment based on supplier deals or customer demand?
market_offer_strategy.why_ask: Buying what suppliers push instead of what customers need leads to dead stock and lost sales.
market_offer_strategy.risk_if_ignored: You tie up cash in slow-moving items and miss the peak season demand.

product_integrity_compliance.question: Can you trace every batch of product to the specific customer who bought it?
product_integrity_compliance.why_ask: Without batch traceability, a single quality complaint or recall can destroy your reputation and create liability.
product_integrity_compliance.risk_if_ignored: You cannot defend against false claims or execute a recall, leading to fines and brand damage.

sourcing_supplier_control.question: Do you vet suppliers and negotiate clear terms, or just buy from whoever has stock?
sourcing_supplier_control.why_ask: Reliance on unvetted suppliers increases the risk of poor quality, late delivery, and price shocks.
sourcing_supplier_control.risk_if_ignored: You face stockouts or quality issues during critical seasons, losing customer trust.

inventory_storage_fulfillment.question: Do you strictly enforce First-Expire-First-Out (FEFO) to manage shelf life?
inventory_storage_fulfillment.why_ask: Chemicals and seeds have limited shelf life; poor rotation guarantees write-offs.
inventory_storage_fulfillment.risk_if_ignored: You lose margin to expired stock and disposal costs.

sales_channels_partner_network.question: Do you control dealer pricing and training, or just sell to any reseller?
sales_channels_partner_network.why_ask: Uncontrolled dealers undercut your price and fail to support the product, damaging your brand.
sales_channels_partner_network.risk_if_ignored: You lose market value and end users get poor results, blaming your product.

customer_success_stewardship.question: Do you provide safe-use training and advisory, or just hand over the product?
customer_success_stewardship.why_ask: Farmers often misuse inputs; without guidance, they blame the product for poor results.
customer_success_stewardship.risk_if_ignored: You face high complaint rates and lose repeat customers to competitors who offer advice.

pricing_finance_credit.question: Is your pricing based on true landed cost, or just following competitors?
pricing_finance_credit.why_ask: Ignoring freight, shrink, and finance costs in pricing means you might be selling at a loss.
pricing_finance_credit.risk_if_ignored: You bleed profit on every sale while thinking you are competitive.

data_traceability_ci.question: Do you use data to forecast demand, or rely on gut feel?
data_traceability_ci.why_ask: Guessing demand leads to stockouts of winners and overstock of losers.
data_traceability_ci.risk_if_ignored: You miss the season's revenue peak because you ran out of the right product.

MINING_SERVICES_HOOKS: Prequalification panic costs you contracts before you even bid.
Facilitation payments are a tax on your reputation and your margin.
Unvetted subcontractors are a shadow risk waiting to explode.
Paper shield safety doesn't stop incidents—it just documents them.
Scope creep is a tax you pay for not defining boundaries.
One-off chaos prevents you from building recurring revenue.
Waiting for the phone to ring is not a sales strategy.
Unclear quotes are an invitation for margin bleed.
Downtime is a penalty you pay for reactive maintenance.
Stockouts are a choice to lose revenue.
Being busy but broke is the ultimate profit leak.
POULTRY_HOOKS: Your profit is bleeding through feed spillage and feeder height.
Ammonia isn’t just smell — it’s invisible weight loss.
Bad brooding is a 14-day mistake you pay for 42 days.
If water pressure fails, your birds stop converting — silently.
You’re not losing eggs — you’re losing cash in trays.
Mortality is not ‘normal’ — it’s unaccounted cost of production.
Heat stress steals growth like a thief — no alarms, no receipts.
Biosecurity is not cleanliness — it’s discipline when people are tired.
Mixed sizes create bullying, uneven weights, and hidden discounts.
Your farm is busy… but the numbers are missing.
PRODUCE_AGGREGATION_HOOKS: Margin gets murdered in the middle. Shrink is invisible theft.
You don't have a supply chain—you have a surprise chain.
Cash is bleeding in slow motion through weight loss.
Buying without specs is donating profit to farmers.
No lot code means no defense against claims.
Selling to whoever calls is the fastest way to lose value.
Storage rot is money evaporating into the air.
Quality fade during transport is a tax you pay every trip.
If you can't trace the batch, you own the risk.
Volume is vanity; margin after shrink is sanity.
SHEEP_HOOKS: Your profit is leaking through lamb survival — not adult animals.
Worms don't just reduce growth… they steal months of weight.
Your pasture isn't grass — it's your bank account.
You're feeding sheep, but not feeding performance.
Footrot is a 'slow disaster' that eats your margin daily.
Flystrike turns one small hygiene issue into a cash emergency.
You don't have a flock plan — you have a flock situation.
You're selling sheep by need… buyers are buying by weight.
Dry season doesn't 'hurt profit' — it resets your flock backward.
If you can't measure lamb growth, you're guessing your future cash.
The farm looks busy, but the cash is quiet.

Market: Blind pricing means the buyer keeps your profit.
Weight guessing is a tax on your income.
Operations: Inbreeding is a silent productivity thief.
Feeding everyone the same wastes feed and stunts growth.
Parasites eat your profit before you see them.
Money: If you don't separate cash, you don't have a business.
Keeping unproductive animals is an expensive hobby.
Feed waste is money on the floor.
People: Training by watching leads to mistakes by guessing.
One person doing everything means nothing is done perfectly.
Routine beats heroic effort every time.

We choose sites by forage calendar, not convenience.
We maintain water access and windbreak/shade as needed.
We map nectar flows and dearth periods; feed is planned, not reactive.
We separate yards to reduce drifting/robbing pressure.
We avoid pesticide hot zones and coordinate with nearby farmers.
We track yield by yard to know which locations pay.
We move/position hives for airflow and moisture control.

We plan expansion only where forage can support it.

We measure brood pattern and population, not vibes.
We make splits with clear goals (increase, replacement, sales).
We manage genetics for temperament + productivity + hygiene.
We keep spare queens / nucleus colonies to prevent downtime.
We prevent chronic drone-laying / failing queens through early detection.
We equalize colonies before flow (balance strength).
We avoid “permanent weak hives” (they become pest magnets).
We manage swarming proactively to protect honey yield.
We track queen age and performance by hive ID.
We use inspection checklists and record outcomes.
We run the apiary by seasonal milestones (build-up, flow, dearth, winter/dry season).
We control entrances/space to reduce robbing and improve ventilation.
We keep equipment ready before flow (supers, frames, extractor schedule).
We standardize feeding decisions (when, what, why).
We limit stress: avoid over-opening in cold/windy conditions.
We manage space well (supering timing, preventing congestion).
We train helpers with SOPs to reduce mistakes.
We monitor Varroa with a real count method (e.g., alcohol wash) and act on thresholds.
We rotate treatments appropriately and follow labels/local guidance.
We prevent robbing/drifting (reduces disease spread).
We quarantine/screen new colonies and used equipment.
We practice apiary hygiene and reduce pest harborage.
We renew old comb on a schedule (reduces pathogen load).
We can recognize brood disease signs early and isolate.
We track disease incidents per yard and respond fast.
We maintain strong colonies (weak ones get robbed/diseased).
We harvest only ripe honey and protect moisture levels.
We use clean, food-grade processes and controlled storage.
We prevent contamination (smoke, debris, chemicals, dirty water).
We minimize time from harvest → extraction → sealed storage.
We standardize bucket/drum labeling and lot separation.
We maintain extractor capacity so we don’t delay harvest.
We prevent robbing during harvest operations.
We meet moisture/quality targets consistently.
We keep lot traceability from yard → extraction → buyer.
Labels are accurate (origin, batch, weight, handling).
We avoid residues by following approved practices and local rules.
We store honey correctly to preserve taste/aroma and prevent spoilage.
We can prove production practices to buyers (trust premium).
We keep records that support disease tracing and food safety.
We know our best channels (farm gate, retail, online, bulk, contracts).
We price by margin, not competitors.
We have repeat customers and a simple retention system.

We use seasonal campaigns aligned to harvest windows.
We build brand trust with traceability and consistency.
We separate wholesale stock from premium retail stock.
We know profit per hive (not just total revenue).
We track inputs: feed, treatments, containers, labor, transport.
We separate capex (equipment) from opex (running costs).
We plan cash flow around harvest and dearth/winter.
We track inventory: supers, frames, wax, drums, jars.
We budget replacements (queens, comb, boxes).
We quantify losses (theft, deadouts, spoilage) and reduce them.
We place hives “where there is space,” not where forage supports yield.

We only measure sales, not profit per hive.
Equipment costs hide in “one-time purchases” forever.

We can’t explain why some yards lose money.

library.text: Stock appears available in conversation but is not consistently traceable by location, count, and movement records.
library.cost_text: Phantom stock drives search delays, missed sales, and shrinkage blind spots; this typically behaves like a 1-5% monthly profit leak in hardware retail.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will lock stock truth using zone labeling, receiving controls, and fast-mover count discipline.

library.text: Phantom Stock
Fast-moving construction essentials are discovered as out-of-stock at point-of-sale instead of being protected by reorder triggers.
library.cost_text: In project-led buying, stockouts can redirect full job spend to competitors; common impact is 2-6% of monthly sales at risk.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will secure Top-30 fast movers with min/max and daily low-stock actions.

library.text: Stockout Tax
Delivery preparation depends on memory and calls, increasing wrong-item and wrong-quantity shipments.
library.cost_text: Every dispatch error burns re-delivery fuel, delays payment, and triggers settlement discounts; this often compounds into recurring monthly margin loss.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will enforce pick-list, load-check, and POD discipline to stop avoidable delivery rework.

library.text: Dispatch Drift
Breakage and returns are treated as routine instead of quarantined, measured, and eliminated by cause.
library.cost_text: Unmanaged breakage becomes a daily profit drip in cement, tile, paint, and fragile categories; typical drag is 0.5-2.5% of sales.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will isolate breakage causes and enforce handling and stacking controls.

library.text: Breakage Bleed
Cash is trapped in low-turn inventory while fast movers risk starving, forcing reactive purchasing behavior.
library.cost_text: Dead stock weakens restock power and increases discount pressure; trapped cash frequently reaches 5-25% of inventory value.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will rank dead stock by value and launch controlled cleanup without destroying price integrity.

library.text: Slow-Mover Cemetery
Sales activity is visible, but net margin is unclear once discounts, breakage, delivery, and credit leakage are included.
library.cost_text: Margin mirage typically hides 2-8% revenue leakage when costs are not mapped by category.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will build a category margin bridge so every leak has a number and owner.

library.text: Discounting behavior varies by pressure and person, training customers to negotiate margin down.
library.cost_text: A 3-5% unmanaged price drift can erase a large share of monthly profit in thin-margin categories.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will install discount bands and approvals that protect close rates and margin.

library.text: Discount Drift
Cash and momo movement is not reconciled with enough daily rigor, allowing variance to normalize.
library.cost_text: Small unresolved variances become a permanent monthly tax and reduce decision accuracy.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will enforce daily reconciliation and variance reason coding.

library.text: Credit Sinkhole
Supplier price changes are reaching the counter faster than price-book updates, compressing margin silently.

library.text: The shop depends too heavily on walk-ins and chance repeat behavior instead of a structured follow-up system.
library.cost_text: Without repeat protection, acquisition effort resets continuously and compounding revenue weakens.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will build repeat and referral loops tied to contractor and buyer records.

library.text: One-Time Buyer Curse
Customer choice is being driven mainly by price because trust and reliability proof are under-leveraged.
library.cost_text: Price-only positioning increases churn and compresses margin over time.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will deploy trust proof and value scripts that reduce price pressure.

library.text: Price-Comparison War
Quotes are sent but not tracked and followed, so high-intent buyers drift to faster or more organized competitors.
library.cost_text: Quote leakage is silent churn: pipeline effort spent without close-rate conversion.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will install quote logging and follow-up cadence to raise conversion quickly.

library.text: Quote Leakage
Critical indicators are not visible enough for early intervention, so leak detection happens late.
library.cost_text: Late detection amplifies stockout, discount, and dispute losses that could have been prevented.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will install a KPI wall and daily cadence with named owners.

library.text: Discount, credit, refund, and exception decisions queue behind one person, slowing execution.
library.cost_text: Decision latency creates lost sales, delayed resolution, and avoidable customer friction.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will implement approval limits and delegation boundaries that keep control without delay.

library.text: Approval Bottleneck
Known issues recur because fixes rely on effort bursts instead of system closure routines.
library.cost_text: Recurring incidents multiply payroll effort and margin loss every month.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will enforce root-cause closure on top recurring leaks.

library.text: Repeat Leak Tax
Project bundles and offer tests are underused, limiting AOV growth and structured upsell.
library.cost_text: Without tested bundles, each sale carries lower realized margin and slower learning velocity.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will launch high-probability project-kit experiments and track outcomes.

library.text: No Bundle Engine
Too many critical steps rely on memory and ad hoc communication, increasing repeat errors.
library.cost_text: Manual chaos drives hidden rework time and slower quote/order throughput.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will standardize templates and lightweight automation in high-error workflows.

library.text: Stock mix is not being refreshed fast enough by demand signals, so slow movers linger and winners starve.
library.cost_text: Stagnant assortment traps cash and lowers conversion in active project categories.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will align assortment refresh to turns and repeat-demand data.

library.text: Stagnant Assortment
Product authenticity controls are too weak for high-risk lines and supplier variance scenarios.
library.cost_text: A single counterfeit event can trigger refunds, contractor distrust, and lasting reputation damage.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will activate an approved-supplier firewall and verification routine.

library.text: Counterfeit Landmine
Stock movement and access controls are too loose, allowing small losses to normalize.
library.cost_text: Yard shrink often behaves like a 0.5-3% inventory-value leak per month when controls are weak.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will lock access, high-risk counting, and variance accountability.

library.text: Yard Shrink
Delivery and returns disputes are recurring because terms and proof standards are inconsistent.
library.cost_text: Dispute tax appears as settlement discounts, delayed cash, re-delivery cost, and trust erosion.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will standardize terms, POD evidence, and return handling to reduce disputes sharply.

library.text: Dispute Tax
Handling and stacking safety controls rely on caution rather than repeatable routines and logging.
library.cost_text: Incidents can create stock loss, downtime, liability exposure, and preventable operational shocks.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will implement basic safety routines and incident prevention cadence.

library.text: Safety Exposure
Operational shortcuts are filling process gaps, increasing dispatch errors, disputes, and inconsistent service quality.
library.cost_text: Shortcut culture feels fast but creates a recurring loss loop across errors, rework, and trust damage.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will install onboarding and role-level certification that preserves speed and quality.

library.text: Shortcut Culture
Volume-only incentives are pushing discounting and risky selling behavior that weakens net profitability.
library.cost_text: Misaligned incentives increase margin leakage and service disputes even when sales volume looks strong.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode will align incentives to margin, accuracy, and low-dispute outcomes.

library.text: OPERATIONS - {STATUS}: We detected {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2}, which typically signals a Line Bottleneck Tax plus WIP Flood problem: bundles pile up, operators wait for missing parts, and the line looks busy while output per hour quietly drops. In CMT, profit is speed plus consistency; slow flow becomes an invisible payroll leak. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} through idle time, delayed completion, and last-minute overtime. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode generates a 7-day line balance and WIP clamp so your current staff produces more without extra hours.

MONEY - {STATUS}: Signals show {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - often Costing Fog plus Overtime Profit Leak. Many CMT factories price per piece but do not protect margin per style, especially when rework and overtime spike. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} because meeting the deadline becomes the business model. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode builds a style-level costing sheet (SMV + rework + overtime) so you stop accepting orders that steal profit.

MARKET - {STATUS}: We detected {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - commonly Buyer Dependency Risk plus Spec Confusion Loss. If one buyer dominates, they control your pricing and tolerance, and unclear specs turn into disputes, rework, and chargebacks. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} in penalties and weak negotiating power. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode generates a buyer-proof system: spec lock checklist + delivery promise tracking + proof packs that protect your reputation.

LEADERSHIP - {STATUS}: Leadership signals indicate {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - meaning output may depend on who is supervising, and recurring defects repeat without closure. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} as performance swings between shifts and blame replaces improvement. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode assigns line owners, sets daily huddles, and forces weekly closure on your top 3 repeat problems.

INNOVATION & CREATIVITY - {STATUS}: We detected {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - in CMT this often means Process Innovation Freeze and missed productivity upgrades (layout, method improvement, small digital tracking). Cost: {COST_IMPACT} because your factory is competing with faster factories. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode launches a 30-day speed upgrade sprint (SMV reduction + layout + checklists) tied directly to output/hour.

RISK - {STATUS}: Signals show {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - often a Compliance Cliff risk (buyer audits, labor standards) and Contract Penalty Trap (late and defect deductions). Cost: {COST_IMPACT} plus contract loss risk if audits fail. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode creates an audit-ready compliance vault and penalty prevention plan so your contracts stop being fragile.

PEOPLE - {STATUS}: People signals show {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - commonly Skill Variance Tax and fatigue/rework loops. If quality depends on a few stars, every absence becomes production collapse. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} via defects, rework, and missed delivery. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode installs training ladders + skill certification so output becomes stable and scalable.

OPERATIONS - {STATUS}: We detected {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2}, which often points to Changeover Chaos (many variations per client) plus Order Fulfillment Drag. Uniform orders die in the finishing stage: missing sizes, wrong embroidery/branding, and packing errors create rework and delays. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} through repacking, missed delivery dates, and refund or redo cycles. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode creates a 7-day order accuracy system: job cards + finishing checklist + packing verification.

MONEY - {STATUS}: Signals show {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - typically Margin Mirage (Style-Level) + Dead Stock Graveyard (fabric and trims left over from custom jobs). Uniform shops leak money through leftovers, incorrect costing, and rushed overtime to meet client deadlines. Cost: {COST_IMPACT}. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode installs job costing + leftovers monetization rules so custom work stops creating dead stock.

MARKET - {STATUS}: We detected {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - often a weak sales pipeline beyond referrals, plus low proof of reliability. Uniform clients buy reliability: delivery date, consistent sizing, consistent branding. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} in lost repeat contracts and weak pricing power. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode generates a B2B renewal system (reorder cycles, corporate account follow-ups, proof portfolio).

LEADERSHIP - {STATUS}: Leadership signals indicate {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2} - meaning production planning is reactive and staff roles blur under pressure. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} as you compete on price instead of value. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode launches a 30-day differentiation sprint: premium options + sizing standard + proof pack.

Cliffhanger: Fix Mode builds a 7-day job card + measurement verification + fitting schedule system.

Sourcing Strength: We have approved supplier lists with clear specs. We do season planning and volume commitments rather than daily panic buying. We use supplier scorecards and pay based on verified weights.
Sourcing Leak: Buying is reactive; we chase trucks, not plans. Supplier quality varies wildly with no enforcement. Hidden middlemen commissions distort true cost. We overbuy then dump.
Sourcing KPIs: % volume from approved suppliers, Supplier quality pass rate at intake (%), Supplier usable yield after grading (%), Cost variance vs target.
Quality Strength: We have written grade standards with photos/examples. We sample every load using a consistent method. We separate grades physically and label clearly.
Quality Leak: Grading is 'eyeballing' and varies by who is on duty. No clear reject rules. Mixed grades stored together collapse price. Claims are emotional, not evidence-based.
Quality KPIs: Intake pass rate (%), Rejection rate (% loads rejected), Downgrade rate (% volume downgraded), Claims cost (as % sales).
Logistics Strength: We plan dispatch and consolidate loads efficiently. We measure and reduce dwell time. Storage follows FIFO/FEFO rules. Cold chain is maintained where needed.
Logistics Leak: Trucks wait too long; quality degrades. No temperature discipline. Storage is disorganized. No real FIFO; old stock hides. Transport damage isn't tracked.
Logistics KPIs: Dwell time (hours), On-time dispatch (%), Storage loss (%), Transport damage rate (%), Cold chain compliance.
Sales Strength: We sell into multiple channels. We maintain buyer service levels (fill rate, on-time). We document specs and meet them reliably.
Sales Leak: We sell to whoever calls. Pricing is inconsistent. We miss buyer specs and lose accounts. Low fill rates. No sales pipeline or contracts.
Sales KPIs: Gross margin by channel, Fill rate (%), On-time delivery (%), Repeat buyer rate (%), Sales concentration risk.
Pricing Strength: We know our true landed cost per grade. We set a margin rule by channel. Discounts require approval. We price confidently using market signals.
Pricing Leak: We don't know real cost; we price blind. We chase volume with discounts. Shrink isn't priced into deals. Freight surprises erase margin.
Pricing KPIs: Gross margin %, Contribution margin, Discount rate (%), Deal approval compliance, Price realization.
Cash Strength: We match payment terms. We invoice fast and reconcile daily. We have credit limits and enforce them. We track cash conversion cycle.
Cash Leak: We advance suppliers but give buyers long credit. Invoices are late. Credit is informal. No cash forecasting. Cash leakages at buying points.
Cash KPIs: DSO (days sales outstanding), Cash conversion cycle, Collection rate (%), Dispute rate (%), Bad debt %.
Inventory Strength: We run cycle counts and reconcile regularly. We measure shrink by stage. We enforce labeling discipline and control access.
Inventory Leak: No inventory truth; numbers are guesses. Shrink is blamed on 'market'. Rework and rejects disappear. Missing weigh tickets create fraud space.
Inventory KPIs: Shrink % (weight + value), Stock accuracy %, Cycle count variance, Write-off %, Rework yield %.
People Strength: Roles are clear. KPIs are visible and reviewed weekly. Incentives reward margin + compliance. Training exists for grading/hygiene.
People Leak: One person holds too many controls (fraud risk). KPIs not defined. Incentives push volume over quality. Conflict between buying and sales.
People KPIs: Output per labor hour, Error rate, Training completion %, Staff turnover, Incentive payout vs margin alignment.
Compliance Strength: We have lot codes and records. We follow hygiene codes. We understand trade terms (Incoterms). Contracts and COAs are managed.
Compliance Leak: No lot code. Records are missing. Chemical storage/hygiene create safety risk. Contracts are vague.
Compliance KPIs: Traceability completeness %, Mock recall time, Audit pass rate, Nonconformance incidents, Claims resolved within SLA %.
Margin gets murdered in the middle. Shrink is invisible theft. Moisture is profit's silent enemy.
You don't have a supply chain—you have a surprise chain. Cash is bleeding in slow motion.
Operations run with stock truth, disciplined replenishment, pick-pack-check execution, planned routes, and POD-backed delivery reliability.

library.text: Fast movers are starving while demand is present, forcing firefighting replenishment and lost repeat baskets.
library.cost_text: Top-SKU stockouts in FMCG commonly bleed 2-6% of monthly sales through lost repeats and emergency restocking.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode rebuilds Top-SKU replenishment so availability becomes automatic, not emotional.

library.text: Stockout Tax
System stock and physical stock are drifting, creating phantom availability and wrong purchase decisions.
library.cost_text: Uncontrolled variance typically hides 0.5-3% of inventory value monthly, plus downstream stockout loss.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode turns stock guessing into stock truth with cycle count cadence and variance ownership.

library.text: Inventory Fog
Warehouse accuracy is inconsistent, so wrong picks and redeliveries are consuming delivery capacity.
library.cost_text: Even low dispatch error rates create repeat fuel, labor, and trust loss that compounds every week.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces pick-pack-check and dispatch audits so wrong supply stops being normal.

library.text: Pick Error Leak
Routes are consuming fuel/time with weak sequencing and missing POD, increasing disputes and re-deliveries.
library.cost_text: Route inefficiency of 10-20% is common and shows up as fuel burn, fewer drops/day, and avoidable disputes.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode tightens route design and POD discipline so delivery stops behaving like a gamble.

library.text: Route Bleeding
Returns, damage, and expiry are being processed as routine noise instead of root-caused loss.
library.cost_text: Unmanaged returns/damages often consume 1-4% of monthly sales, with expiry quietly wiping category profit.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode isolates top loss reasons and installs quarantine + FEFO routines to stop recurrence.

library.text: Silent Margin Erosion
Supplier and receiving errors are entering stock truth, then resurfacing later as disputes and stockouts.
library.cost_text: Supplier OTIF volatility drives rush purchases and avoidable emergency costs while accuracy declines.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode locks receiving checks and supplier scorecards so supplier chaos stops cascading internally.

library.text: Receiving Blindspot
Sales activity is high, but discounts, returns, shrinkage, fuel, and credit losses are swallowing net margin.
library.cost_text: Unmeasured margin killers can leak 2-8% of revenue, and higher volume often amplifies the leak.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds a margin bridge so every leak has an owner, a number, and a deadline.

library.text: Margin Mirage
Pricing and discounting behavior is inconsistent, training customers to negotiate instead of buying value.
library.cost_text: A 3-5% unmanaged discount drift can erase a major share of profit in thin-margin FMCG models.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs discount guardrails so discounting becomes strategic, not emotional.

library.text: Discount Addiction
Receivables are growing faster than collections, forcing the business to finance customer working capital.
library.cost_text: Weak AR discipline typically bleeds 1-3% of revenue through delays/defaults and triggers emergency borrowing.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode converts collections into routine operations with tiered credit controls.

library.text: Credit Sinkhole
Small reconciliation variances are accumulating and hiding true business performance.
library.cost_text: Minor daily cash variances compound into material monthly loss and distort decision quality.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode locks reconciliation truth and exception control so numbers can be trusted again.

library.text: Cash Handling Ghosts
Promotions are moving volume without clear margin contribution or repeat-order lift.
library.cost_text: 20-60% of promo spend often fails to produce profit improvement when ROI discipline is missing.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode converts promos into measured experiments so only profitable campaigns survive.

library.text: Promo Burn
Slow-moving stock is trapping cash while winners are underfunded and restocking power weakens.
library.cost_text: Dead stock commonly traps 5-25% of inventory value, driving stockouts and borrowing pressure.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode releases trapped cash and resets buying logic around fast-moving winners.

library.text: Repeat customers are quietly reducing order frequency and basket size without formal churn events.
library.cost_text: Losing key repeat accounts can erase months of growth and leave inventory mix unstable.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode finds repeat-order breakers and launches a protection routine for key accounts.

library.text: Silent Churn
Visit effort is spread evenly, so high-value outlets are under-served while low-return coverage consumes time.
library.cost_text: Unsegmented coverage depresses sales/rep productivity and makes repeat demand fragile.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode applies outlet segmentation and visit cadence to protect high-value demand first.

library.text: Coverage Waste
Shelf visibility and availability are inconsistent, giving competitors easier replacement access.
library.cost_text: Weak shelf execution causes gradual volume erosion even when price is competitive.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode restores shelf discipline where it matters most for repeat pull-through.

library.text: Shelf Neglect Leak
Territory and channel expansion is outpacing service reliability and working-capital control.
library.cost_text: Uncontrolled expansion increases delivery failures, disputes, and AR stress simultaneously.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode expands only where reliability and margin are sustainable.

library.text: Expansion Chaos
Complaint resolution is reactive and non-learning, allowing repeat service failures to compound.
library.cost_text: Unresolved complaints increase churn probability and weaken pricing power over time.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode eliminates top complaint causes so trust stops bleeding.

library.text: Complaint Loop
Average order value is shrinking because bundle and cross-sell mechanics are weak.
library.cost_text: Lower basket size raises cost-to-serve per UGX sold and forces harder new-customer acquisition.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds bundle plays that grow basket size without discount addiction.

library.text: Basket Blindness
Core leaks stay hidden because the business is operating without a stable KPI truth wall.
library.cost_text: Late detection inflates the cost of stockouts, overdue AR, shrinkage, and failed delivery recovery.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs visible KPI cadence so action becomes faster and cheaper.

library.text: Recurring issues are discussed but not structurally closed, so the business keeps paying the same tax.
library.cost_text: Repeat stockouts, disputes, and returns create permanent margin drain when closure discipline is weak.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces proof-of-fix so repeated incidents decline instead of recycling.

library.text: Repeat Leak Tax
Centralized approvals are delaying dispatch, pricing, and collections decisions that should move in real time.
library.cost_text: Decision latency converts speed into revenue leakage and worsens service reliability.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode removes approval bottlenecks without losing control.

library.text: Approval Gridlock
Sales, warehouse, and finance are optimizing locally instead of to shared profit outcomes.
library.cost_text: Cross-team misalignment silently wastes payroll time and drives customer trust decay.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode aligns teams around shared KPIs so conflict stops consuming margin.

library.text: Internal Friction Leak

library.text: Credit, discount, and return rules exist but are inconsistently enforced under pressure.
library.cost_text: Policy loopholes become margin loopholes and are quickly exploited by both teams and customers.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces policy through workflow and exception tracking.

library.text: Policy Drift
Coaching and performance decisions are made without consistent role-level scorecards.
library.cost_text: Payroll is spent on activity while performance variance stays high.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode converts performance into measurable scorecards and coaching loops.

library.text: Performance Guessing
Improvements are being guessed, not tested, so change effort does not reliably move KPIs.
library.cost_text: Untested changes waste time and money while measured improvements are delayed.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs a test-and-learn rhythm that compounds measurable gains.

library.text: No Test Rhythm
Order capture remains unstructured, creating recurring wrong orders and avoidable dispute load.
library.cost_text: Unstructured ordering multiplies correction costs and customer frustration.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode structures order capture so errors fall and scaling becomes easier.

library.text: App Without Process
SKU sprawl and weak bundle design are increasing complexity while suppressing basket growth.
library.cost_text: Slow movers trap cash and starve fast movers, reducing both turns and order value.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode rationalizes assortment and installs profitable bundle logic.

library.text: Assortment Chaos
Routing performance is not measured consistently, so inefficiencies persist unchanged.
library.cost_text: 10-20% logistics inefficiency is common when route design is unmanaged.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode makes route performance measurable and continuously improvable.

library.text: Route Intelligence Gap
Metrics are fragmented, so teams debate numbers and react late to known leak patterns.
library.cost_text: Bad data produces expensive decisions and delayed leak detection.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode standardizes trusted data flows and alert-driven response.

library.text: Data Discipline Gap
Supplier variability is forcing emergency operations instead of predictable planning.
library.cost_text: Unstable supply drives stockouts, emergency purchases, and avoidable cash strain.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode aligns supplier collaboration to planning reality and peak demand.

library.text: Supplier Collaboration Gap
Shrinkage is being absorbed as normal, not attacked as preventable loss.
library.cost_text: Uncontrolled shrinkage often runs 0.5-3% of inventory value, plus secondary stockout impact.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode applies simple controls and counts that reduce shrinkage quickly.

library.text: Shrinkage Fog
Credit exposure is rising faster than collection control, converting growth into financial risk.
library.cost_text: Slow AR velocity weakens restocking power and raises default plus borrowing exposure.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs AR defense tiers and escalation routines before defaults spike.

library.text: AR Exposure
Weak POD and unclear dispute rules are creating short-supply claims and forced settlement discounts.
library.cost_text: Disputes consume delivery time, reduce repeat confidence, and erode realized margin.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode locks POD and dispute policy so trust and margin are protected.

library.text: Dispute Tax
Cash custody and reconciliation controls are too loose for current transaction volume.
library.cost_text: Weak controls create silent leakage and decision-quality decay through unreliable numbers.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode hardens reconciliation and audit trails so cash truth is non-negotiable.

library.text: Cash Control Exposure
Supplier verification and compliance evidence are weak, increasing product and regulatory exposure.
library.cost_text: One authenticity or compliance incident can trigger rapid demand and reputation damage.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode establishes verification and compliance routines before a trust event occurs.

library.text: Authenticity & Compliance Risk
Critical incident readiness is weak across safety, data, and business continuity controls.
library.cost_text: One major event can erase months of profit without continuity and response discipline.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs practical continuity and incident control so disruptions stay survivable.

library.text: Continuity Fragility
Current incentives reward behavior that can grow sales while weakening profit and service quality.
library.cost_text: When incentives ignore collections and discipline, discount leakage and risky credit rise together.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode aligns scorecards and incentives to profitable growth behaviors.

library.text: Incentive Misfire
Rep and driver execution variance is causing disputes, wrong deliveries, and avoidable trust loss.
library.cost_text: Behavior drift at the last mile increases disputes and repeat-order erosion.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode standardizes rep-driver discipline with proof-based compliance.

library.text: Last-Mile Behavior Risk
Warehouse errors are repeating because training is informal and standards are not certified.
library.cost_text: Untrained routines create recurring pick errors, re-deliveries, and wasteful correction time.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs warehouse SOP certification so error rates fall quickly.

library.text: Warehouse Error Drift
Critical tasks rely on too few people, so absence instantly destabilizes throughput and quality.
library.cost_text: Hidden fragility cost appears as downtime, rushed errors, and leadership overload.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds cross-coverage so operations remain stable when key staff are absent.

library.text: Single Point Failure
Teams avoid reporting issues early, so small leaks grow quietly into expensive incidents.
library.cost_text: Delayed issue reporting amplifies repeat failures, disputes, and rework costs.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode creates safe reporting and no-blame closure discipline that removes repeat leaks.

library.text: Hidden Leak Culture
Weak onboarding and retention controls are increasing early-stage errors and turnover disruption.
library.cost_text: Poor onboarding inflates ramp-time losses and raises avoidable mistakes in customer-facing workflows.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs onboarding and retention controls to protect consistency as the team grows.

library.text: Stockout Tax
Stock exists in theory but exact variant or pack-size cannot be confirmed fast enough to close sales confidently.
library.cost_text: SKU fog wastes floor time, creates wrong picks, and weakens trust in availability promises.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds SKU and pack-size truth so confirmation is fast and reliable.

library.text: SKU Fog
Shelf layout is neat but not conversion-led, so customers spend too long searching and buy less.
library.cost_text: Slow item discovery reduces conversion and increases staff interruption load.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode deploys shelf maps and fast-lane zones optimized for speed and basket size.

library.text: Shelf Maze
Printing and photocopy jobs are managed verbally, causing reprints, delays, and payment disputes.
library.cost_text: Queue chaos turns a high-frequency service into avoidable rework and reputation drag.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs ticketed queue control with proof checkpoints.

library.text: Queue Chaos
Slow-moving books and legacy items sit for long periods, tying cash while fast movers starve.
library.cost_text: Dead inventory reduces restock power and forces reactive discounting.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode runs dead-stock recovery with bundle, markdown, and transfer rules.

library.text: Dead Book Trap
Sales look active but category-level profitability is unclear once discounts, shrink, and returns are included.
library.cost_text: Without category margin truth, decisions scale volume while hiding profit loss.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds category margin maps and leak reviews.
library.kpi_text: Gross margin by category, Net margin estimate

library.text: Margin Mirage
library.kpi_text: Gross margin by category, Net margin estimate

library.text: Discounting happens by negotiation mood instead of clear bands, compressing margin each day.
library.cost_text: Random discounting trains buyers to negotiate and steadily erodes pricing power.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces discount bands and bulk pricing guardrails.

library.text: Bargain Drift
Credit is extended without disciplined limits and collections cadence, trapping cash needed for peak stock.
library.cost_text: Delayed collections weaken restocking power and increase bad debt risk.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs credit tiers, aging visibility, and cutoff rules.

library.text: Credit Sink
Cash and momo reconciliation is inconsistent, so daily variances and small-item shrink become normalized.
library.cost_text: Small unresolved variances become permanent monthly leakage.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces daily money truth and shrink exception logging.

library.text: Cash Drawer Drift
Printing and photocopy prices are set by market guess, not by full paper-toner-time cost.
library.cost_text: Busy print desks can destroy margin when service costs are not priced accurately.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs print cost calculators and job-type pricing corrections.
library.kpi_text: Cost per print job, Print margin %

library.text: Hidden Service Leak
library.kpi_text: Cost per print job, Print margin %

library.text: Schools and offices are served ad hoc without a structured account rhythm, so predictable bulk revenue is lost.
library.cost_text: Lack of account discipline weakens repeat volume and planning accuracy.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds school and office contract outreach plus renewal cadence.

library.text: School Contract Miss
Parents and students buy once and disappear because there is no retention follow-up system.
library.cost_text: Replacing buyers repeatedly is more expensive than retaining known buyers.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode launches VIP and follow-up loops that convert one-time buyers to repeat demand.

library.text: One-Time Buyer Curse
Inquiry responses are slow and inconsistent, so high-intent orders are lost to faster competitors.
library.cost_text: In fast retail channels, response latency directly reduces conversion.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode sets response SLAs and templates for faster close rates.

library.text: WhatsApp Blackhole
Selling items one-by-one instead of ready kits reduces average order value and checkout speed.
library.cost_text: Missed bundles leave margin on the counter and slow service in peak hours.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode deploys back-to-school and office kits with scripts.

library.text: Bundle Blindness
Weekly truth on stockouts, shrink, margin, and season readiness is not visible enough to drive early correction.
library.cost_text: Late leak detection increases loss size and reaction cost.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode puts KPI visibility and weekly review cadence in place.

library.text: KPI Darkness
Routine exceptions wait for one decision-maker, slowing sales and resolution speed.
library.cost_text: Decision delay creates checkout friction and lost demand.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode sets delegation limits and approval matrixes.

library.text: Approval Bottleneck
The same mistakes recur because corrective actions are not embedded into standard routines.
library.cost_text: Repeat leak tax drains margin and team energy every week.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces standards coaching and repeat-leak elimination rituals.

library.text: Repeat Leak Tax
Season campaigns are reactive and late, causing stock mismatches and missed demand windows.
library.cost_text: Missing seasonal timing weakens both sales and stock efficiency.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds seasonal campaign and pre-buy calendars.
library.kpi_text: Seasonal readiness score, Campaign execution score

library.text: Seasonality Shock
library.kpi_text: Seasonal readiness score, Campaign execution score

library.text: High-margin add-on services are offered inconsistently and not tracked as a growth lever.
library.cost_text: Service underutilization lowers basket value and customer convenience stickiness.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode productizes services and tracks upsell performance.

library.text: Service Opportunity Leak
Supplier trust is not backed by verification evidence in risk categories like textbooks and branded supplies.
library.cost_text: One counterfeit incident can trigger refund waves and trust collapse with schools and parents.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs approved supplier firewall and authenticity checks.

library.text: Counterfeit/Piracy Landmine
Small items disappear quietly due to weak access and monitoring discipline.
library.cost_text: Small-ticket shrink compounds into large monthly profit erosion.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode hardens small-item theft controls and shrink dashboards.

library.text: Theft Tax
Supplier deliveries are accepted without rigorous counting and evidence, leaving claim recovery weak.
library.cost_text: Short-delivery losses and invoice errors quietly reduce usable margin.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs receiving verification and claim workflow evidence.

library.text: Supplier Short-Delivery
Unclear terms for printing and returns create recurring refund and reprint disputes.
library.cost_text: Dispute tax shows up as rework, concessions, and trust erosion.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs terms-proof workflows to reduce arguments and losses.

library.text: Dispute Tax
Staff do not consistently guide customers to faster and higher-value purchases like kits and relevant add-ons.
library.cost_text: Scriptless selling lowers conversion speed and average basket value.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode certifies product navigation and bundle scripts across shifts.

library.text: Accuracy and control behaviors are under-incentivized, so miscounts, variances, and avoidable errors persist.
library.cost_text: Careless handling increases shrink, disputes, and operational rework.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode aligns incentives to profitable and accurate behavior.

library.text: OPERATIONS - {STATUS}: We detected {LEAK_1} and {LEAK_2}, which often signals No-Drawings Chaos and Fit-Up Failure Loop. In structural work, one wrong measurement becomes a full refabrication - steel does not forgive. When fit-up is improvised, weld distortion increases, alignment fails, and rework becomes normal. Cost: {COST_IMPACT} through scrap, rework labor, and site returns. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode generates a 7-day drawing lock + fit-up SOP + stage QC gates so steel leaves the shop right the first time.

Structural jobs look profitable until you add the real weld hours, grinder time, transport, and site adjustments. Cost: {COST_IMPACT}. Cliffhanger: Fix Mode builds a job-costing template that prices steel + labor + consumables + transport so you stop winning jobs that lose money.

We sell to a defined buyer type (butchers/feedlots/exporters) with clear specs.
We price by weight/grade/condition, not 'per head guessing'.
We sell when cash pressure hits, not when the market is best (distress selling).
Prices are set by buyers; we accept because we lack options.
Average selling price per kg liveweight (or carcass kg) by channel.
We run a clear system (cow-calf, backgrounding, fattening) with targets.
We cull consistently (poor fertility, chronic sickness, bad temperament).
Breeding is unplanned; calving is scattered and chaotic.
We expand herd size before stabilizing survival/feed.
Calving rate = calves born / cows exposed.
We run a seasonal feed plan (pasture + conserved feed + supplements).
We protect water access and quality daily (water is non-negotiable).
Feed decisions are reactive ('when pasture finishes, we panic').
Pasture is overgrazed; recovery is slow; costs rise.
Average Daily Gain (ADG) by batch.
We operate a practical farm biosecurity plan (visitor control, quarantine).
We detect illness early using daily checks and record symptoms.
Animals mix freely (new, sick, old) and disease spreads fast.
Treatments are late; we only act when animals collapse.
Mortality rate and 'cause known %'.
We have functional fencing, gates, handling crush, and safe loading routine.
We schedule maintenance (troughs, pumps, pasture, housing).
Weak fencing causes losses, disputes, and theft risk.
No crush/handling system → vet work becomes dangerous and delayed.
Equipment downtime hours/month (water pumps, crush).
Everyone has clear roles (feeding, health checks, records).
We use simple SOPs (feeding, calving assistance, quarantine).
No clear accountability; problems bounce between people.
Staff are untrained in early illness signs; detection is late.
Routine completion score (% daily checklist done).
We know cost per kg gain and use it to decide.
We separate farm money from personal money.
We don’t know cost per animal/day; profitability is unknown.
Personal spending drains business cash weekly.
Gross margin per animal (or per batch).
We link performance (growth, fertility) to feed inputs where possible.
We use a monthly review to choose 1–2 improvements.
Records are incomplete; decisions are guesswork.
No traceability → buyer trust is low; disputes rise.
Record completeness score (births, deaths, sales logged).
We sell based on readiness + market demand windows, not only cash pressure.
We use weight/condition to set price floors and negotiate confidently.
We know our top 3 buyer types (trader, butcher, breeder) and sell strategically to each.
We sell mainly when cash is tight, even if animals are not ready.
We price by guesswork and negotiate from a weak position.
We mix breeders and finishers, so we sell valuable genetics as meat animals.
Average selling price per head (by grade: breeder / finisher / cull).
We run controlled breeding windows to align births with feed availability and demand.
We keep and replace stock using performance (survival, mothering, weaning) not appearance only.
Breeding is uncontrolled; kidding/lambing happens anytime.
We tolerate infertility, poor mothering, and chronic sickness.
Kidding/lambing rate (births per breeding female).
We plan feeding by season + life stage (late pregnancy, lactation, weaners, finishers).
We have a dry-season strategy (fodder, hay, crop residues, browse management).
Feeding changes only when animals visibly lose condition.
All animals share one ration/access, so priority groups suffer.
Body Condition Score (BCS) distribution (thin/ok/fat) monthly.
We have a routine parasite control strategy (rotation, targeted treatment, pasture management).
We isolate/screen new animals before mixing.
We treat when animals are already sick, not early.
Parasite control is routine-only (same drug/schedule) without strategy, causing poor results.
Mortality rate (adult, kid/lamb) monthly/seasonal.
We prevent losses with reliable fencing, housing, and predator/theft controls.
We schedule maintenance routines instead of reacting after breakdowns.
Fencing and housing are reactive; losses happen before repairs.
Theft/predation losses (# and value per month).
Daily tasks have clear ownership and checklists (feed, water, health, security, records).
Work is informal; critical tasks are missed when someone is absent.
Checklist completion rate (% days completed).
We separate farm money from personal money.
Farm money and personal money are mixed, hiding true profit.
Gross margin per animal sold (sale – direct costs).

library.text: Device stock is not reliably traceable in real time, so search time, missing units, and wrong availability promises are increasing.
library.cost_text: Inventory ghosting can consume 1-5% of monthly profit, and one missing high-value phone can erase a full day of margin.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode locks stock truth and IMEI discipline so every device has a clear record and location trail.

library.text: Inventory Ghost
Fast-moving accessories are missing at point of sale, reducing attach rate and forcing customers to buy elsewhere.
library.cost_text: Missing accessories quietly remove 5-20% of potential margin per phone transaction in many shops.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode secures Top-30 accessory availability and attach scripts to protect daily margin.

library.text: Accessory Graveyard
Repairs are moving without visible stage control, creating delays, rework, and customer disputes at handover.
library.cost_text: Untracked repairs produce repeated labor loss, longer turnaround, and comeback-driven trust erosion.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs job cards, approvals, and QC gates so repair flow becomes predictable.

library.text: Repair Black Hole
Device and part receiving is inconsistent on condition and serial checks, importing avoidable disputes into the shop.
library.cost_text: Receiving drift creates wrong pricing, supplier friction, and downstream warranty losses that look random.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces receiving and grading discipline before bad stock enters active inventory.

library.text: Daily open-close controls are weak, so cash, stock movements, and pending repair statuses diverge by shift.
library.cost_text: Small routine misses compound into monthly leakage, missed handovers, and decision delays.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode deploys non-negotiable open-close routines to stabilize day-to-day control.

library.text: Routine Drift
Sales activity is high but true category-level profit is unclear, so hidden losses remain unmanaged.
library.cost_text: Without a margin map, shops often leak 2-8% of revenue through unmanaged discounts, returns, and warranty costs.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds a category margin bridge so each leak gets a number, owner, and deadline.

library.text: Pricing and discount behavior varies by urgency and negotiation, steadily training customers to push margin down.
library.cost_text: A 3-5% unmanaged price drift can erase most profit in thin-margin phone and accessory sales.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs discount bands and approval limits that preserve margin without killing close rates.

library.text: Discount Drift
Cash and momo movement is not reconciled with enough rigor, creating daily variance and weak financial truth.
library.cost_text: Small daily variances become a permanent monthly tax and distort business decisions.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces daily reconciliation and exception logging so cash truth is restored.

library.text: Cash Drawer Drift
Warranty and return boundaries are unclear, driving avoidable repairs, refunds, and dispute settlements.
library.cost_text: Warranty bleed can consume 10-30% of realized profit in used or refurbished-heavy models when unmanaged.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode clarifies warranty tiers and tracks cost per 100 sales to stop preventable exceptions.

library.text: Installment and account terms are expanding faster than collections discipline, weakening restock cash.
library.cost_text: Credit sinkholes turn booked sales into delayed cash, increasing stock starvation and borrowing pressure.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs deposit, limit, and AR cadence controls to protect cash velocity.

library.text: Credit Sinkhole
Shoppers are not receiving consistent trust proof on condition, authenticity, and warranty clarity.
library.cost_text: Weak trust signals force price-only decisions, reduce AOV, and increase post-sale disputes.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds a trust engine that increases confidence and price resilience.

library.text: Trust Erosion
Lead capture and response times are inconsistent, so high-intent inquiries go cold before conversion.
library.cost_text: Slow response can erase channel ROI and bleed daily sales to faster competitors.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs capture templates and response SLAs to convert more inquiries.

library.text: Lead Leak
Phone sales are closing without consistent accessory attach behavior, reducing realized margin per transaction.
library.cost_text: Missed attach opportunities make each phone sale less profitable and increase dependency on unit volume.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs bundle defaults and scripts that lift basket value without discount wars.

library.text: Attach Rate Collapse
Follow-up, review requests, and referral loops are weak, so repeat demand is left to chance.
library.cost_text: Without a repeat engine, customer acquisition cost rises and growth stays fragile.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode converts one-time buyers into repeat and referral behavior through simple routines.

library.text: One-Time Buyer Curse
Critical numbers are not visible daily, so leak detection is delayed and decisions stay reactive.
library.cost_text: Late detection inflates the cost of stockouts, discount drift, disputes, and AR slippage.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs KPI wall cadence so action happens before losses compound.

library.text: Discount, refund, and warranty exceptions are waiting too long for central approval.
library.cost_text: Decision latency creates missed closes, delayed resolution, and avoidable customer friction.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode introduces delegation limits that preserve control and restore speed.

library.text: Approval Bottleneck
Scorecards and coaching are inconsistent, so known issues repeat by staff, shift, and stress level.
library.cost_text: Payroll effort rises without matching quality and margin outcomes when accountability is soft.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode ties coaching and scorecards to leak reduction outcomes.

library.text: Repeat Leak Tax
Offers are changing by instinct instead of measured tests, slowing growth learning.
library.cost_text: No experiment rhythm means missed margin opportunities and slower adaptation to market behavior.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode creates monthly offer experiments with clear win-loss decisions.

library.text: Offer Stagnation
Repair services are not packaged by tier, so delivery promises and pricing vary excessively.
library.cost_text: Unstructured services undercharge complexity and increase dispute probability.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode productizes repair tiers to raise margin and predictability.

library.text: Manual workflows are creating repeat mistakes because templates and simple systems are underused.
library.cost_text: Manual drift increases handling time and correction cost across sales and repair workflows.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode applies lightweight automation to remove recurring errors quickly.

library.text: Automation Lite Gap
IMEI and intake verification gaps increase exposure to high-impact legal and reputational incidents.
library.cost_text: A single stolen-device event can trigger outsized financial and trust loss relative to shop size.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode builds an IMEI firewall that prevents unknown-device intake risk.

library.text: Stolen Device Landmine
Part authenticity controls are weak, increasing repeat failures and warranty labor burn.
library.cost_text: Fake or unstable parts generate rework loops that consume technician time and customer trust.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode enforces approved parts and supplier-quality discipline to break comeback loops.

library.text: Fake Parts Comeback Loop
Return and warranty disputes are rising because acceptance boundaries and evidence are weak.
library.cost_text: Dispute tax appears as refunds, rework time, negative reviews, and reduced repeat trust.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode installs written rules and evidence flows to cut dispute frequency.

library.text: Dispute Tax
High-value stock and cash controls are too loose, enabling silent leakage through movement and custody gaps.
library.cost_text: Shrinkage often runs 0.5-3% of inventory value monthly in weak-control environments.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode strengthens access, counts, and reconciliation so leakage becomes visible and controllable.

library.text: Silent Shrink
Staff are rewarded for speed and revenue, not margin quality, attach quality, and low-return behavior.
library.cost_text: Incentive mismatch drives discounting, overselling, and avoidable return cycles.
library.cliffhanger_text: Fix Mode realigns incentives to profit-safe behaviors across sales and repairs.

We price by cost-to-serve, not vibes (handling, dwell time, temp bands, special services).
We run SLAs that are measurable (temp range, response times, loading windows, documentation).
We actively manage capacity utilization (not just 'space available').
We segment customers by risk profile (claims history, compliance, payment behavior).
We use minimum storage days / demurrage rules to prevent slow-moving stock from killing space.
Every inbound load has documented checks (temp, condition, seals, count/weight).
We enforce lot/batch identification from day one (no 'mystery pallets').
We maintain traceability from inbound → storage location → outbound.
We apply quarantine/hold zones for questionable loads.
Continuous temperature monitoring + alarms + records (no 'we checked yesterday').
Grain stored at safe moisture and actively managed (not 'we dried once').
Aeration / temperature monitoring to suppress insects/mold (prevention > treatment).
Pest control program + hygiene + inspection routine.
Dock scheduling prevents congestion and claims ('queue = damage').
WMS or structured inventory system prevents 'inventory mirage.'
FEFO/FIFO discipline is enforced.
Cycle counts happen weekly; we don't wait for year-end shocks.
Energy KPIs are tracked (cold storage can bleed profit silently).
Preventive maintenance calendar for refrigeration / generators / aeration fans / conveyors.
Calibration schedule for thermometers, moisture meters, weigh scales.
Incident reporting and corrective actions reduce repeat losses.
Pricing is 'per pallet/per bag' with no cost-to-serve logic → margin disappears.
No clear SLA → every dispute becomes emotional.
Too many risky customers (late payers / high claims) because 'cash today.'
No rules for slow movers → space gets hijacked.
Loads are accepted without evidence → you 'own' the problem later.
Lots/batches get mixed → traceability collapses.
No quarantine/hold zone → contaminated/poor stock infects everything.
Paperwork is inconsistent → export customers reject documentation later.
No continuous logging/alarms → excursions go undetected.
Door discipline is weak → 'temperature tax' hits energy + product quality.
Moisture isn't actively controlled → mold/mycotoxin risk climbs.
Pest control is reactive → infestations become expensive rescues.
'We think we have it' inventory → stock-outs and overstock at the same time.
Congested docks → damage, delays, demurrage.
Maintenance is reactive → breakdowns create catastrophic losses.
No calibration → disputes you cannot win.
Energy is unmanaged → profit evaporates quietly.
Claims repeat because lessons aren't converted into SOPs.
Capacity utilization % (by zone: chilled/frozen/ambient/silo).
Revenue per cubic meter / pallet position / ton stored.
SLA compliance rate (measurable clauses).
% inbound loads with complete receiving checklist + photos.
Lot/batch capture rate (should be ~100%).
Temperature excursion count + minutes outside range.
Grain temperature trend per bin.
Dock-to-stock time.
Pick accuracy %.
Dispatch on-time-in-full (OTIF).
Preventive maintenance completion %.
Net operating margin.
Recordable incidents (safety).
Ghost pallets — you're invoicing what you think you have, not what's really there.
Traceability blackout — one recall and your documentation can't keep up.
Temperature tax — every lazy door-open is money leaving your cold room.
Dock-to-stock drag — if it takes hours to put away, you're creating damage before storage even begins.
Energy vampire — your compressor runs 24/7 but nobody knows the kWh per pallet.
Breakdown cliff — one compressor failure and you lose a warehouse floor overnight.
Alarm fatigue — alarms ring, nobody responds, product dies.
Commercial Shield: Price by cost-to-serve, enforce SLAs, and segment clients by risk.
Receiving Discipline: Evidence at the gate, lot control from day one, dispute-proof documentation.
Condition Fortress: Continuous monitoring, alarm response, pest prevention, moisture vigilance.
Throughput Engine: Dock scheduling, slotting rules, cycle counts, accuracy gates.
Profit Lock: Track energy KPIs, invoice by service line, manage cash weekly.
Asset Shield: PM calendar, calibration register, generator testing, root-cause discipline.
Learning Loop: Every incident becomes a rule change, not just a report.
We win on a clear niche (e.g. specialized irrigation, harvesting) rather than chasing every job.
We have defined service territories and response-time promises we actually hit.
We sell uptime (service plans, seasonal checks), not just emergency repairs.
We chase 'any job' to stay busy, attracting price shoppers and late payers.
Seasonal peaks crush us, but the off-season is silent due to zero pipeline planning.
We rely on one big client; losing them would collapse our cash flow.
Win rate by segment (% quotes won: installs vs repairs).
Revenue mix: % recurring service plans vs one-off jobs.
We price with a clear rate card (labor, travel, machine hours, overtime).
We separate diagnostic fees from repair/install quotes.
We charge for mobilization and minimum hours on every callout.
We quote from memory, making every job a new negotiation.
We underprice travel and setup time, eating into our margins.
Discounts are emotional ('the client insisted') rather than rule-based.
Gross margin % per job type (install / repair / hire).
Quote accuracy (% jobs within ±10% estimated hours).
We book jobs with triage rules (crop-at-risk, severity) to prioritize correctly.
We confirm parts availability before promising dates to customers.
Everything is urgent; technicians choose jobs randomly or based on who shouts loudest.
No route planning leads to daily fuel and time leaks.
First-time fix rate %.
SLA hit rate (% calls responded within target window).
We run preventive maintenance (PM) schedules based on machine/engine hours.
We have a workshop standard: tools controlled, cleanliness, and calibration.
Maintenance happens only after breakdown; we operate an emergency-only fleet.
'Borrowed tools' culture leads to lost time searching for equipment.
Uptime % (available hours / planned hours).
Mean Time To Repair (MTTR).
Parts are controlled with bin locations, reorder points, and cycle counts.
We stock critical spares for the top 20 failure points to prevent downtime.
'Parts in pockets' culture means shrinkage is treated as normal.
Stockouts cause idle crews and broken promises to customers.
Inventory accuracy (%).
Fill rate (% jobs completed without parts delay).
We have a defined skills matrix and training cadence for technicians.
We enforce LOTO, guarding, and PPE; safety is a system, not a poster.
We depend on one 'hero technician' while everyone else is weak.
Safety shortcuts are tolerated, creating injury risk and legal liability.
Technician productivity (billable hours / paid hours).
Safety incident rate (TRIR / near-miss reporting).
We enforce clear payment terms: deposit, milestones, and completion sign-off.
Fuel, lubricants, and consumables are tracked and reconciled per job.
We finish work before deposits are paid, effectively funding our customers.
No cost center tracking means job profitability is pure guesswork.
Days Sales Outstanding (DSO).
Asset utilization rate (%).
We use standard checklists for installs, commissionings, and closeouts.
Customer feedback triggers specific process fixes, not just apologies.
Critical data exists only in WhatsApp chats, making analysis impossible.
Repeat failures aren't analyzed, so we keep suffering the same costs.
Checklist compliance rate %.
Repeat failure rate (top 10 faults).
Stock is controlled by SKU-size-color, arrivals follow receive-tag-price-display-photo flow, and fulfillment uses proof before handover.
